00056 /*******************************************************************
00057 **
00058 ** SCH_CustomEarlyInit
00059 **
00060 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00061 **
00062 ** This function MUST update SCH_AppData.ClockAccuracy to the
00063 ** resolution of the minor frame timer.
00064 ********************************************************************/
00065 
00066 int32 SCH_CustomEarlyInit(void)
00067 {
00068     int32             Status = CFE_SUCCESS;
00069     
00070     Status = OS_TimerCreate(&SCH_AppData.TimerId,
00071                              SCH_TIMER_NAME,
00072                             &SCH_AppData.ClockAccuracy,
00073                              SCH_MinorFrameCallback);
00074     
00075     return Status;
00076 
00077 } /* End of CustomEarlyInit() */
00078 
00079 
00080 /*******************************************************************
00081 **
00082 ** SCH_CustomLateInit
00083 **
00084 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00085 **
00086 ** This function MUST perform any startup synchronization required,
00087 ** and MUST finish setting up the major and minor frame timers. 
00088 ********************************************************************/
00089 
00090 int32 SCH_CustomLateInit(void)
00091 {
00092     int32  Status    = CFE_SUCCESS;
00093     
00094     CFE_ES_WaitForStartupSync(SCH_STARTUP_SYNC_TIMEOUT);
00095 
00096     /*
00097     ** Connect to cFE TIME's time reference marker (typically 1 Hz)
00098     ** to use it as the Major Frame synchronization source
00099     */
00100     Status = CFE_TIME_RegisterSynchCallback((CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t)&SCH_MajorFrameCallback);
00101     if (Status == CFE_SUCCESS)
00102     {
00103         /*
00104         ** Start the Minor Frame Timer with an extended delay to allow a Major Frame Sync
00105         ** to start processing.  If the Major Frame Sync fails to arrive, then we will
00106         ** start when this timer expires and synch ourselves to the MET clock.
00107         */
00108         Status = OS_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_STARTUP_PERIOD, 0);
00109     }
00110 
00111     return Status;
00112 
00113 } /* End of SH_CustomLateInit() */
00114

00116 /*******************************************************************
00117 **
00118 ** SCH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber
00119 **
00120 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00121 ********************************************************************/
00122 
00123 uint32 SCH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber(void)
00124 {
00125     uint32  CurrentSlot;
00126     
00127     if (SCH_AppData.SyncToMET != SCH_NOT_SYNCHRONIZED)
00128     {
00129         CurrentSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00130         
00131         /* 
00132         ** If we are only concerned with synchronizing the minor frames to an MET,
00133         ** then we need to adjust the current slot by whatever MET time is prevalent
00134         ** when the Major Frame Signal is received.
00135         ** If we are synchronizing the Major Frame, then, by definition, LastSyncMETSlot
00136         ** would be a zero and the current slot would be appropriate.
00137         */
00138         if (CurrentSlot < SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot)
00139         {
00140             CurrentSlot = CurrentSlot + SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS - SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot;
00141         }
00142         else
00143         {
00144             CurrentSlot = CurrentSlot - SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot;
00145         }
00146     }
00147     else
00148     {
00149         CurrentSlot = SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone;
00150     }
00151     
00152     return CurrentSlot;
00153 } /* End of SH_CustomGetCurrentSlotNumber() */
00154 
00155 /*******************************************************************
00156 **
00157 ** SCH_CustomCleanup
00158 **
00159 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see 'sch_custom.h'
00160 ********************************************************************/
00161 
00162 void SCH_CustomCleanup(void)
00163 {
00164     /* unregister the TIME callback for the major frame */
00165     CFE_TIME_UnregisterSynchCallback((CFE_TIME_SynchCallbackPtr_t)&SCH_MajorFrameCallback);
00166 
00167 } /* End of SH_CustomCleanup() */

00170 /*******************************************************************
00171 **
00172 ** SCH_GetMETSlotNumber
00173 **
00174 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00175 ********************************************************************/
00176 
00177 uint32 SCH_GetMETSlotNumber(void)
00178 {
00179     uint32 SubSeconds = 0;
00180     uint32 MicroSeconds;
00181     uint32 Remainder;
00182     uint32 METSlot;
00183     
00184     /*
00185     ** Use MET rather than current time to avoid time changes
00186     */
00187     SubSeconds = CFE_TIME_GetMETsubsecs();
00188 
00189     /*
00190     ** Convert sub-seconds to micro-seconds
00191     */
00192     MicroSeconds = CFE_TIME_Sub2MicroSecs(SubSeconds);
00193 
00194     /*
00195     ** Calculate schedule table slot number
00196     */
00197     METSlot = (MicroSeconds / SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00198 
00199     /*
00200     ** Check to see if close enough to round up to next slot
00201     */
00202     Remainder = MicroSeconds - (METSlot * SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00203     
00204     /*
00205     ** Add one more microsecond and see if it is sufficient to add another slot
00206     */
00207     Remainder += 1;
00208     METSlot += (Remainder / SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00209     
00210     /*
00211     ** Check to see if the Current Slot number needs to roll over
00212     */
00213     if (METSlot == SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS)
00214     {
00215         METSlot = 0;
00216     }
00217     
00218     return METSlot;
00219     
00220 }
00221 
00222 
00223 /*******************************************************************
00224 **
00225 ** SCH_MajorFrameCallback
00226 **
00227 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00228 ********************************************************************/
00229 
00230 void SCH_MajorFrameCallback(void)
00231 {
00232     /*
00233     ** Synchronize slot zero to the external tone signal
00234     */
00235     uint16 StateFlags;
00236 
00237     /*
00238     ** If cFE TIME is in FLYWHEEL mode, then ignore all synchronization signals
00239     */
00240     StateFlags = CFE_TIME_GetClockInfo();
00241     
00242     if ((StateFlags & CFE_TIME_FLAG_FLYING) == 0)
00243     {
00244         /*
00245         ** Determine whether the major frame is noisy or not
00246         **
00247         ** Conditions below are as follows:
00248         **    If we are NOT synchronized to the MET (i.e. - the Minor Frame timer
00249         **    has an acceptable resolution), then the Major Frame signal should
00250         **    only occur in the last slot of the schedule table.
00251         **
00252         **    If we ARE synchronized to the MET (i.e. - the Minor Frame timer is
00253         **    not as good as we would like), then the Major Frame signal should
00254         **    occur within a window of slots at the end of the table.
00255         */
00256         if (((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET == SCH_NOT_SYNCHRONIZED) && 
00257              (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone != SCH_TIME_SYNC_SLOT)) ||
00258             ((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET == SCH_MINOR_SYNCHRONIZED) && 
00259              (SCH_AppData.NextSlotNumber != 0) && 
00260              (SCH_AppData.NextSlotNumber < 
00261               (SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS - SCH_AppData.WorstCaseSlotsPerMinorFrame - 1))))
00262         {
00263             /*
00264             ** Count the number of consecutive noisy major frames and the Total number
00265             ** of noisy major frames.  Also, indicate in telemetry that this particular
00266             ** Major Frame signal is considered noisy.
00267             */
00268             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrame = TRUE;
00269             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrameCount++;
00270 
00271             /*
00272             ** If the Major Frame is not being ignored yet, then increment the consecutive noisy
00273             ** Major Frame counter.
00274             */
00275             if (!SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame)
00276             {
00277                 SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter++;
00278                 
00279                 /*
00280                 ** If the major frame is too "noisy", then send event message and ignore future signals
00281                 */
00282                 if (SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter >= SCH_MAX_NOISY_MAJORF)
00283                 {
00284                     SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame = TRUE;
00285                 }
00286             }
00287         }
00288         else /* Major Frame occurred when expected */
00289         {
00290             SCH_AppData.UnexpectedMajorFrame = FALSE;
00291             SCH_AppData.ConsecutiveNoisyFrameCounter = 0;
00292         }
00293         
00294         /*
00295         ** Ignore this callback if SCH has detected a noisy Major Frame Synch signal
00296         */
00297         if (SCH_AppData.IgnoreMajorFrame == FALSE)
00298         {
00299             /*
00300             ** Stop Minor Frame Timer (which should be waiting for an unusually long
00301             ** time to allow the Major Frame source to resynchronize timing) and start
00302             ** it again with nominal Minor Frame timing
00303             */
00304             OS_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00305     
00306             /*
00307             ** Increment Major Frame process counter
00308             */
00309             SCH_AppData.ValidMajorFrameCount++;
00310     
00311             /*
00312             ** Set current slot = zero to synchronize activities
00313             */
00314             SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = 0;
00315             
00316             /*
00317             ** Major Frame Source is now from CFE TIME
00318             */
00319             SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource = SCH_MAJOR_FS_CFE_TIME;
00320             
00321             /* Clear any Major Frame In Sync with MET flags */
00322             /* But keep the Minor Frame In Sync with MET flag if it is set */
00323             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET &= SCH_MINOR_SYNCHRONIZED;
00324             
00325             /*
00326             ** Give "wakeup SCH" semaphore
00327             */
00328             OS_BinSemGive(SCH_AppData.TimeSemaphore);
00329         }
00330     }
00331 
00332     /*
00333     ** We should assume that the next Major Frame will be in the same MET slot as this 
00334     */
00335     SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00336 
00337     return;
00338 
00339 } /* End of SCH_MajorFrameCallback() */
00340 
00341 
00342 /*******************************************************************
00343 **
00344 ** SCH_MinorFrameCallback
00345 **
00346 ** NOTE: For complete prolog information, see above
00347 ********************************************************************/
00348 
00349 void SCH_MinorFrameCallback(uint32 TimerId)
00350 {
00351     uint32  CurrentSlot;
00352     
00353     /*
00354     ** If this is the very first timer interrupt, then the initial 
00355     ** Major Frame Synchronization timed out.  This can occur when
00356     ** either the signal is not arriving or the clock has gone into
00357     ** FLYWHEEL mode.  We should synchronize to the MET time instead.
00358     */
00359     if (SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource == SCH_MAJOR_FS_NONE)
00360     {
00361         SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource = SCH_MAJOR_FS_MINOR_FRAME_TIMER;
00362         
00363         /* Synchronize timing to MET */
00364         SCH_AppData.SyncToMET |= SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH;
00365         SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft = SCH_MAX_SYNC_ATTEMPTS;
00366         SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = 0;
00367     }
00368     
00369     /* If attempting to synchronize the Major Frame with MET, then wait for zero subsecs before starting */
00370     if (((SCH_AppData.SyncToMET & SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH) != 0) &&
00371         (SCH_AppData.MajorFrameSource == SCH_MAJOR_FS_MINOR_FRAME_TIMER))
00372     {
00373         /* Whether we have found the Major Frame Start or not, wait another slot */
00374         OS_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00375 
00376         /* Determine if this was the last attempt */
00377         SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft--;
00378 
00379         CurrentSlot = SCH_GetMETSlotNumber();
00380         if ((CurrentSlot != 0) && (SCH_AppData.SyncAttemptsLeft > 0))
00381         {
00382             return;
00383         }
00384         else  /* Synchronization achieved (or at least, aborted) */
00385         {
00386             /* Clear the pending synchronization flag and set the "Major In Sync" flag */
00387             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET &= ~SCH_PENDING_MAJOR_SYNCH;
00388             SCH_AppData.SyncToMET |= SCH_MAJOR_SYNCHRONIZED;
00389             
00390             /* CurrentSlot should be equal to zero.  If not, this is the best estimate we can use */
00391             SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = CurrentSlot;
00392             SCH_AppData.LastSyncMETSlot = 0;
00393         }
00394     }
00395     else
00396     {
00397         /*
00398         ** If we are already synchronized with MET or don't care to be, increment current slot
00399         */
00400         SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone++;
00401     }
00402 
00403     if (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone >= SCH_TOTAL_SLOTS)
00404     {
00405         /*
00406         ** If we just rolled over from the last slot to slot zero,
00407         ** It means that the Major Frame Callback did not cancel the
00408         ** "long slot" timer that was started in the last slot
00409         **
00410         ** It also means that we may now need a "short slot"
00411         ** timer to make up for the previous long one
00412         */
00413         OS_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_SHORT_SLOT_PERIOD, SCH_NORMAL_SLOT_PERIOD);
00414         
00415         SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone = 0;
00416         
00417         SCH_AppData.MissedMajorFrameCount++;
00418     }
00419 
00420     /*
00421     ** Determine the timer delay value for the next slot
00422     */
00423     if (SCH_AppData.MinorFramesSinceTone == SCH_TIME_SYNC_SLOT)
00424     {
00425         /*
00426         ** Start "long slot" timer (should be stopped by Major Frame Callback)
00427         */
00428         OS_TimerSet(SCH_AppData.TimerId, SCH_SYNC_SLOT_PERIOD, 0);
00429     }
00430     
00431     /*
00432     ** Note that if this is neither the first "short" minor frame nor the
00433     ** last "long" minor frame, the timer is not modified.  This should
00434     ** provide more stable timing than introducing the dither associated
00435     ** with software response times to timer interrupts.
00436     */
00437 
00438     /*
00439     ** Give "wakeup SCH" semaphore
00440     */
00441     OS_BinSemGive(SCH_AppData.TimeSemaphore);
00442 
00443     return;
00444 
00445 } /* End of SCH_MinorFrameCallback() */
00446
